Rule.NonCompliantComment: MongoDB is using the default port, which may expose the server to unauthorized access.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure that MongoDB uses a non-default port. Command: 1. Open the MongoDB configuration file (mongod.conf). 2. Set the following under net: net: port: 3. Restart the MongoDB service using systemctl restart mongod.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Operating system resource limits are not set for MongoDB, which may allow resource exhaustion.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure that operating system resource limits are set for MongoDB. Command: 1. Open the limits configuration file for MongoDB (e.g., /etc/security/limits.conf). 2. Add or modify the following lines: mongodb soft nproc 64000 mongodb hard nproc 64000 mongodb soft nofile 64000 mongodb hard nofile 64000 3. Restart the MongoDB service using systemctl restart mongod.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Server-side scripting is enabled in MongoDB, which may allow execution of unauthorized JavaScript code.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure that server-side scripting is disabled if not needed. Command: 1. Open the MongoDB configuration file (mongod.conf). 2. Set the following under security: security: javascriptEnabled: false 3. Restart the MongoDB service using systemctl restart mongod.
Rule.Correction: sed -i '/security:/a\ javascriptEnabled: false' /etc/mongod.conf; systemctl restart mongod
